get.description: Get current Chatwoot configuration for a session. Returns the real configuration from database if configured, or a generic "not configured" response if no configuration exists. Accepts both global API key and session-specific API key for authentication.

200.description: Configuration found (if configured=true) or not configured message (if configured=false)

401.description: Unauthorized - API key required (use global or session-specific key)

post.description: Configure Chatwoot integration for a WhatsApp session. This endpoint allows you to set up the connection between your WhatsApp session and Chatwoot. You can use either the global API key or the session-specific API key for authentication. When isActive=true, accountId, token, and url are required fields.

parameters.description: Chatwoot configuration with all available options
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad request - validation errors or missing required fields

401.description: Unauthorized - API key required (use global or session-specific key)
